plants.name: Digitalis purpurea
plants.description: A tall biennial herbaceous plant known for its tubular, bell-shaped flowers that are typically purple with spotted throats. It is often found in woodlands and open meadows.
plants.funFact: Foxglove flowers are important for pollinators like bees, who crawl inside the tubular flowers to gather nectar.

plants.name: Lagerstroemia indica
plants.description: A deciduous tree or shrub famous for its long summer blooming period and crinkly, crepe-like petals. It thrives in warm climates and is popular in urban landscapes.
plants.bloomingSeason: Late spring through summer (May to September)
plants.location: Native to Southeast Asia, widely cultivated in the southern United States and other warm temperate to tropical regions

plants.name: Rhododendron macrophyllum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub with large clusters of pink to purple fragrant flowers, native to the Pacific Northwest. It prefers moist, acidic soils in forested areas.
plants.funFact: Rhododendron macrophyllum is the state flower of Washington state.

plants.name: Jacaranda mimosifolia
plants.description: A deciduous tree known for its stunning display of delicate, trumpet-shaped purple flowers appearing in spring to early summer, often lining streets and parks in warm climates.
plants.location: Native to South America, widely planted in Australia, South Africa, and southern USA
plants.funFact: Jacaranda flowers carpet the ground when they fall, creating vivid purple carpets beneath the trees.
